metadata.title: CVE-2020-10685 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in Ansible Engine affecting Ansible Engine versions 2.7.xbefore 2.7.17 and 2.8.x before 2.8.11 and 2.9.x before 2.9.7 as well asAnsible Tower before and including versions 3.4.5 and 3.5.5 and 3.6.3 whenusing modules which decrypts vault files such as assemble, script,unarchive, win_copy, aws_s3 or copy modules. The temporary directory iscreated in /tmp leaves the s ts unencrypted. On Operating Systems which/tmp is not a tmpfs but part of the root partition, the directory is onlycleared on boot and the decryp emains when the host is switched off. Thesystem will be vulnerable when the system is not running. So decrypted datamust be cleared as soon as possible and the data which normally isencrypted ble.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10685` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ansible - 2.9.7+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ansible package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.9.7+dfsg-1').
